review: For the price, it is hard to criticize the Fire TV Stick. You get access to Amazon's Instant Video and Prime Video, as well as other Prime services like music and photos. There are also a lot of 3rd party apps you can download for accessing content from other services like Netflix, Hulu, and Pandora. What I don't like about the stick is that streaming is not smooth. Video playback often "stutters" and pauses, sometimes bumping down to a lower quality. It's not my network because Apple TV and Playstation do not have these problems using the same services. I think the problems are likely due to either the built-in WiFi receiver and/or on-board memory to buffer content.
